meanings.definition: A strict adherence to basic principles or beliefs
meanings.sent1: Her fundamentalisms guided her actions in life.
meanings.sent2: The community's fundamentalisms shaped their traditions.
meanings.sent3: He took his fundamentalisms so seriously, he wouldn't even try new foods.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, her fundamentalisms were like a timeless classic.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's fundamentalisms were as unyielding as a mountain.

meanings.definition: The belief in the literal interpretation of religious texts
meanings.sent1: Their fundamentalisms led them to interpret the scripture word for word.
meanings.sent2: The fundamentalisms of the group dictated their religious practices.
meanings.sent3: His fundamentalisms about the text were so literal, he thought it was a history book.
meanings.sent4: In their debates, his fundamentalisms clashed with her more open-minded views.
meanings.sent5: The fundamentalisms of the preacher were as clear as the words on a page.

meanings.definition: A movement or attitude stressing strict and literal adherence to a set of basic principles
meanings.sent1: The political party's fundamentalisms resonated with the voters.
meanings.sent2: Their fundamentalisms in education led to a standardized curriculum.
meanings.sent3: She approached her work with fundamentalisms that bordered on obsession.
meanings.sent4: In the art world, his fundamentalisms were like a bold brushstroke.
meanings.sent5: The team's fundamentalisms were as unwavering as a compass needle.
